results.description: A general notion or idea; a mental representation of something.
An idea or opinion produced by thinking, or occurring suddenly in the mind.
A conception of or belief about something.
The ability to see, hear, or become aware of something through the senses. Often influences ideas.
The faculty or action of forming new ideas, or images or concepts of external objects not present to the senses.
The use of imagination or original ideas to create something.
A new idea, method, or device.

results.translation: ブレインストーミング
results.description: A group creativity technique by which efforts are made to find a conclusion for a specific problem by gathering a list of ideas spontaneously contributed by its members.
The process of forming ideas or concepts.
The faculty of reasoning and understanding objectively, especially with regard to abstract or academic matters.
The quality of having experience, knowledge, and good judgment; the quality of being wise. Often applied to the application of ideas.
The capacity to gain an accurate and deep intuitive understanding of a person or thing.
The process of being mentally stimulated to do or feel something, especially to do something creative.
A particular way of considering or regarding something; a point of view.
A particular attitude toward or way of regarding something; a point of view.
The ability to understand something; comprehension.
Knowledge or perception of a situation or fact.
An acceptance that a statement is true or that something exists.
A view or judgment formed about something, not necessarily based on fact or knowledge.
A supposition or a system of ideas intended to explain something, especially one based on general principles independent of the thing to be explained.
A supposition or proposed explanation made on the basis of limited evidence as a starting point for further investigation.
A fundamental truth or proposition that serves as the foundation for a system of belief or behavior or for a chain of reasoning.
The study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence, especially when considered as an academic discipline.
A system of ideas and ideals, especially one which forms the basis of economic or political theory and policy.
A belief or set of beliefs held and taught by a Church, political party, or other group.
An abstract idea; a general notion.
